comments.commentBody: Sounds like so-called President Trump is getting increasingly desperate to avoid a through, bipartisan, independent investigation of his possible collision with Russia to engage in cyber-warfare against his own country.

How quickly Trump backstabs.  After expressing how courteous and helpful President Obama was to him, even saying that he planned to keep Obama's council, Trump creates another lie about his predecessor.  Trump, in the White House, is no better than the Trump who years ago started the ugly, racist birther lie.

I'm beginning to believe that there is a lot more under the covers here than meets the eye, and that when the lid finally gets blown off the repercussions will dwarf any -gate in modern American history. Trump had better hope his allegations are false, for his and his administration's sake.

Maybe Snowden's exposure of the NSA tapping the phones of citizens or the way police have cameras everywhere should be more of an issue for Trump. Especially if he is now complaining that his phone was tapped.

But shouldn't he provide proof about his claim?
The whole Republican Party now owns trump and his rediculous tirades.  They need to speak out now, or be complicit by their silence.

It seems he is panicking because of all his ties to the Russian government are being unveiled one by one and now he tries to create a horrendous distraction. No lie disgusting enough holds this guy back if it is about saving his own skin. And his MO is turning the table around and accusing his opponents with exactly the same thing he actually committed or using the same lowly means he himself actually utilized.

"Trump, Offering No Evidence".  The leading four words of many headlines expected for the unforseeable future.  Is there such a thing as PLSD (Post-Lie Stress Disorder)?  I think I'm suffering from it and I may not be alone.

No, he is not "suffering" from any disorder.  The only way he will be suffering is when he has low ratings and cannot rationalize why that has happened. If he has any disorder he will not get any treatment for it, as long as he continues to have a significant following.

Maybe he has been watching Homeland on showtime and believes it's a documentary? or reruns of 24 or some other Hollywood fantasy where the men in black are everywhere. I can't believe I live in a country where this incompetent is President. Makes Nixon look Jeffersonian

" any such move by a White House counsel would be viewed at the Justice Department as a stunning case of interference."

You forget who is in charge of the Justice Department in the Trump admin. Interference is not the concern-collusion is.

When will this madness end?  Only when that courageous and conscience-driven insider steps forward with the Trump WH secrets, despite knowing this will end their political career.  In the end, though, this hero will brightly outshine all those career driven politicians whose partisan loyalties blindly drove their support for a dangerous madman.

Let us all promise that when that brave soul comes forth with the decisive final proof that we desperately need to impeach Trump we will crowd fund that individual so he or she does not have to worry about losing their job. The situation we are in is not tenable. We need to get rid of Trump and fast. He is making our country into a mess that could take a long time to get over. We need to cut our losses and get this madman out ASAP!
Our so called President is a total flake. Thanks to our "Electoral College" the U.S.A. is now the laughing stock of the Northern Hemisphere. The sooner they impeach this idiot, the better.
Finally time to disband the Electoral "College "....
Not just the Northern Hemisphere, but the whole world.  Why do you suppose so many wealthy people in this country have bought property and even obtained citizenship in other countries?

Oh sure--let’s blame the “Electoral College” or Russia (Yes they interfered but are now saying they really didn’t think he’d win--they’re even backing off this nutcase).

Blame the 7 million voters who went with the three third party candidates OR the 90 million who couldn’t be bothered to vote.

Blame every person who felt Mrs. Clinton’s private email server was somehow as evil as pussygate, mocking the disabled, his view that women are things to be judged as 10s or worth nothing, deriding a gold star family, making fun of a POW who is now his own party’s Senator

Just don’t blame the electoral college!

It is quite obvious to all Americans except the Republicans that Donald J. Trump is not qualified to be president of the Unites States. I suppose the Republicans are not concerned that Republicans conspired with Russia to destroy the United States. The next time a Republican shouts USA! USA! USA! I wish them nothing but damnation. Republicans are the most ant-American and unpatriotic citizens in the western hemisphere. They are a bunch of traitors and phonies! By the way Putin now owns 51% of the Republican Party and 100% of the White House. Problem is , Republicans are  too dumb to figure this out.
Mr. Trump must be required to provide proof of his allegations.  In short, I am embarrassed to say with regard to a sitting president of the United Stated of America:  "put up or shut up."

This is a distraction, and should be taken as a sign that this administration is getting increasingly desperate to deflect attention from reality.

Ignore Trump's tweets. We need to be talking about nothing besides the following three facts:

1. None of the policies that Trump promised his voters will yield any significant economic benefit to anyone but the country's wealthiest 0.1%, and will only exacerbate already odious wealth inequalities, and explode our national debt.

2. Republicans in Congress -- just as has been the case for the last eight years -- have no workable plan to replace Obamacare, or any feasible ideas for how to repair it (at least, in the ways it really needs repairing).

3. The Russian government wanted Trump elected in 2016, and did everything they could to make that happen. Questions remain as to the extent of the Trump campaign's involvement in those efforts, and this administration has done nothing but obstruct reasonable people's attempts to learn more on the matter.
If the name was changed to Trumpcare, the argument would end immediately!

Teri Gross interviewed the New Yorker principals, they believe the Russians essentially, in the process of trying to break into the safe, vaporized it. They only meant to cripple Clinton, not elect Trump.

Reading this, I am incredulous that we and the Times are even having to think about the so-called president's mood swings rather than about the dangerous policy swings that he and the Republican-controlled Congress are engineering. Kill NASA weather satellites? Repeal ACA with no viable eplacement? Vouchers for the rich to subsidize Bunny's tuition at St. Paul's? Really?

But okay, since we are in this debased condition, let's consider that several Obama representatives have said today that our last real president did not, as a matter of policy, involve himself or his team in FISA wiretap warrants. Let's consider that Louise Mensch reported on November 6 that FISA warrants had been issued to look at the Republican candidate's campaign interactions with Russian interests. Let's consider that when the twitterer tweets it is usually to hurl ill-supported insults at people he accuses of doing what he himself did. Let's consider that the current occupant of 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue broke numerous promises he made to reveal his tax returns, which might reveal the extent of his business dealings with Russian interests. Let's consider the meetings with Russian officials by a number of his appointees, family members and retinue, some of whom denied that such meetings happened but that if they did, they were innocent. Let's consider that the Republican congress is stonewalling on a truly independent, bipartisan investigation that would get to the bottom of it. What are they hiding?

I don't know if the Republicans in Congress are abetting Trump's cover-up, which is what this appears to be, but one thing's for sure:  they want to drag this out as long as possible so they can have a friendly hand around to sign into law the right-wing agenda before they can no longer resist calls for his impeachment.
A lot of bad smelling garbage.

There are so many disturbing aspects of this story, but for me, apart from the substance (or lack thereof), is the mental health of the President. Mr. Trump and his administration are understandably anxious to move on from the ongoing story of his campaign's alleged Russian connections, but by his tweets about Senator Schumer and Speaker Pelosi meeting President Putin and the Russian Ambassador (in their official positions, with others and camera present) and now these charges of possibly illegal wiretapping directed toward former President Obama, President Trump is making sure the issue is in the foreground of every news report and in the minds of the voters. This self-destructive behavior seems to indicate a deeply disturbed mind. Sometimes paranoid people are their own worst enemies.

Mr Trumps speech to Congress the other day was widely touted by the pundits as very Presidential as he did not go off in la la land like his recent press conference. How sad it is to see the media falling over themselves to give some gravitas to the narcissist in chief. These latest tweets show that there must be a connection between his campaign and his family with Russian intelligence. This latest tweet storm by Trump shows his desperation to divert the public and press, making unfounded charges with no foundation of evidence to back up these wacky assertions.  Typical way one would expect a con man or junior dictator in waiting to react. Our Republic is in dire danger from this pathetic shell of a President and his host of enablers.

Indeed that is true. Too bad Mr. Trump cannot be presidential unless it is scripted for national TV coverage. Personally I wish the press would stop calling him presidential because of an on script speech.  His regular, consistent behavior has certainly indicated that he is not acting very "presidential". So when he gives a speech or acts in a way that is unusual or out of character for him (based on a lot of his behavior that has been recorded) that is how he should be described  .... not "presidential".  Also, remember, that for the most part his supporters think that his usual behavior is presiidential

It is almost starting to be a shameful thing to be American with headlines like these being made to shame and crazy make our President .. If we could learn to accept that this world if full of things we may not desire or feel is best outcome of situation and that by offering no solution to resolve an issue it then becomes whining and a waste of time and energy is put fourth into staying angry at perceived unfavorable situation.

One has to wonder about the mental health of our President.  The conspiracy theories, lying, compulsive tweeting, grandiose thinking, recklessness, erratic behavior, and ugly interactions with others are going to lead to impeachment or a recognition that he is unfit for office.
let's hope so
Me, I'm wondering whether the mental health of Americans who voted in this Republican Congress is robust enough to make  them stop this.
No one is wondering anymore.  The whole world knows we have a lunatic in the White House.  The Republicans will trade this embarrassment for their agenda.

I suspect that another reason why so many conservatives are fixated on coal is because they know that environmentalists, who tend to be liberal and vote Democratic, hate coal. Environmentalists also make a convienent scapegoat for the loss of coal jobs through the decades.
Yes, any lie will do ...

I would like to live in a country where this was the story that consumed us and consumed the attention of our leaders.

If we cannot rouse ourselves to care, we have lost our souls. Bannon can yammer on about our Judeo-Christian culture. It means nothing.
thank you, paula. it's heartbreaking.
We have just ended eight years of Clinton / Kerry foreign policy. Ranting against Bannon is a ridiculous irrelevancy.
Are you kidding?! At least I hope so. NATO has enough to worry about with the Ukraine. We (the USA) don't need to get involved in Africa again.
True, but the key word is NATO is (supposed to be) non political, and for the most part, this is true.
Count me in too!
Well you fell for it again and now Trumps latest unsubstantiated statement is the top story.

You're right on!  It should be the last paragraph in stories involving the possible collusion of Russia and Trump campaign officials to influence Trump's election.  I predict that tomorrow's tweet will talk about the 5,000,000 (3,000,000 isn't enough) illegal immigrants who voted for Hilary.
